uniol.apt.analysis

Class GenerateStepNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.GenerateStepNet

  • public class GenerateStepNet
extends java.lang.Object
    Generate a step net for of a Petri Net. A step net simulates the step semantics of the given Petri nets. In the step semantics, markings can fire concurrently instead of sequentially. A set of transitions is enabled if there is enough token so that the combination of the presets of the transitions can be satisfied by the available token. For simulating the step semantics, each step is materialized as a transition which combines flows of some other transition.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

      • isMarkingLessOrEqual

        public static boolean isMarkingLessOrEqual(Marking mark1,
                                           Marking mark2)
        Test if a marking is smaller or equal to some other marking.
        Parameters:
        mark1 - The first marking to compare
        mark2 - The second marking to compare
        Returns:
        true iff for every place p: mark1.getToken(p) <= mark2.getToken(p)

      • getMaximalReachableMarkings

        public static java.util.Collection<Marking> getMaximalReachableMarkings(PetriNet pn)
        Get all pairwise uncomparable reachable markings of a Petri net.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose markings should be computed
        Returns:
        A set of reachable markings. There are no two entries a and b in this set for which isMarkingLessOrEqual returns true.

      • isStepReasonable

        public boolean isStepReasonable(java.util.Collection<Transition> transitions)
        Check if a step is reasonable which means that it can be enabled in some reachable marking.
        Parameters:
        transitions - The transitions that should be part of the step.
        Returns:
        true if this step is reasonable.
